alert.note: Alert for Mecosta; Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Mecosta. In west central Michigan, Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. Drivers should be alert for flooded or damaged roads, especially during the darkness when visibility is greatly reduced. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Numerous reports of 4-6 inches of rain over the last 6 hours have been received. The rain is largely over for the night, so water should start to recede over the next few hours. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
